body_html:
First, you should initialize W2 just like W1 in order to break symmetry.
Second, you should compute cross entropy with one of the built-in functions.
It is because of numerical boo boos that you might experience problems.
You might wanna try tf.nn.softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits(labels=y_, logits=y)
And make sure to remove the final tf.nn.softmax as this is done internally.
body_text:
First, you should initialize W2 just like W1 in order to break symmetry.
Second, you should compute cross entropy with one of the built-in functions.
It is because of numerical boo boos that you might experience problems.
You might wanna try tf.nn.softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits(labels=y_, logits=y)
And make sure to remove the final tf.nn.softmax as this is done internally.
body:
First, you should initialize `W2` just like `W1` in order to break symmetry.
Second, you should compute cross entropy with one of the built-in functions.
It is because of numerical boo boos that you might experience problems.
You might wanna try `tf.nn.softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits(labels=y_, logits=y)`
And make sure to remove the final `tf.nn.softmax` as this is done internally.
